lead_paragraph: The bureau managing the city’s retirement funds has not kept up with the times and lacks basic tools to identify risk, according to an independent report commissioned by the city comptroller’s office.

headline.print_headline: City’s Pensions at Risk of ‘Operational Failure,’ Report Says
headline.main: New York City’s Pension System in Danger of ‘Operational Failure,’ Report Says

snippet: The bureau managing the city’s retirement funds has not kept up with the times and lacks basic tools to identify risk, according to an independent report commissioned by the city comptroller’s office.
abstract: Independent report commissioned by New York City Comptroller Scott M Stringer finds Bureau of Asset Management, city's pension system, is riddled with problems that make possibility of operational failure very likely; report calls for more resources and staffing, and warns of system's inability to identify portfolio risk.
